item.title: Fast Minds, Right Minds
item.description:
Players who answered correctly were on average 5.55 seconds faster than those who were wrong. Accuracy clearly rewarded speed!
Fun Fact: Did you know? Studies show that reaction time improves by nearly 15% with competitive music-based games like Kahoot!

item.title: Tamil Debut Questions Stumped Many
item.description:
Only 44.2% of all answers to actor debut questions were correct — proving that even fans struggle with remembering first films.
Fun Fact: Fun fact: Vikram Prabhu’s debut ‘Kumki’ used real elephants during filming — a rare cinematic choice in Tamil cinema!

item.title: Lightning Reflexes in ‘Duet’ Question
item.description:
The highest-scoring player nailed the ‘Prakash Raj debut’ question in just 0.8180000000000001 seconds — proving sharp instincts matter as much as memory.
Fun Fact: Prakash Raj is one of the few Indian actors fluent in 6 languages — making him a true pan-Indian performer!

item.title: Rajinikanth Trivia Ruled, But ‘Kumki’ Lagged
item.description:
Players found Rajinikanth-related trivia easiest, while Vikram Prabhu’s ‘Kumki’ debut question saw the lowest confidence — hinting at generational familiarity gaps.
Fun Fact: Rajinikanth’s fan clubs exist in over 50 countries — including Japan and Nigeria!

item.title: Speedy Answers Project Future Dominance
item.description:
Players with sub-3-second averages are emerging as dominant — suggesting that instinct-based recall could outperform memory-heavy approaches in future rounds.
Fun Fact: Reaction times in quiz formats have been shown to improve by 20% after just three sessions of music-themed play!
